name: Hotel Italia

reviews.text: First, I want to say that I stayed there in July, 2004. Finally I have gotten a chance to write a review. As far as the hotel itself and the location, it was a fine stay. It is a bit of a trek from the train station, but it was manageable.
reviews.title: Great, but....
Nice, convenient hotel.
reviews.text: The breakfast was fine. The room was fine, clean and had enough room.

reviews.title: Great Choice Hotel
reviews.text: Here was my problem...

This was the last stop of our vacation to Italy. For reasons beyond our control, we lost a day before we got to Rome. We had informed the hotel of a problem we had and that we could not make it on our reserved date. I was aware that if you had to cancel your reservation, we would still be obligated to pay for the room. We pleaded with the hotel to help us out and not charge us for the extra night. They would not budge. I understand it is business, but somehow I felt I made every attempt to contact the hotel. The front desk would have nothing of it and they just seemed not to care. So we paid our bill and moved on.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: Make sure you are going to stay on the days you intend.
reviews.title: Good value for the money
Excellent value for money
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Italia in Rome for a week in early February. A good time to go to avoid the crowds. The weather was sunny every day but as you would expect, it was a little chilly in the shade.

reviews.title: Clean, good location, good breakfast
reviews.text: The hotel is within walking distance of all the main attractions, the Colisseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Forum, Panethon etc. We took a short ride on the nearby underground to reach the Vatican. To fully appreciate St Peter's Basilica, the museums and the Sistine Chapel, I would advise more than one visit.

reviews.title: Excellent little hotel
reviews.text: Andreas and the hotel staff were extremely helpful. You can buy travel tickets from reception and they will organise taxis to and from the airport. The rooms, although compact, were cleaned every day and spotless. The maid will even fold your pyjamas! The hotel is classified as 2 star, since it is on the first floor and has no flashy reception area. However, I would rate it at 3 star +.

The rates were very reasonable and breakfast was included. Breakfast included pastries from the nearby pattiserie, cornflakes, yogurt, rolls, pate, cream cheese, jams etc, in addition to tea, coffee and cappucino.
reviews.title: Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful
Hotel Italia was great!
reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend Rome and the Hotel Italia, which is just off the Via Nazionale, the second largest street in Rome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is fine, clean with reasonable sized bedroom and bathroom. No a/c but fan seemed nearly as good to us. Booked a elegant double but got a standard twin. It beside town walls and a nice 20min walk to the very centre. B/fast is not great. The real downside was room overlooked the busy front road, quiet at night but from 6.30 onward not chance to sleep even for a heavy sleeper.
reviews.title: Basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location to the center of the city, but an uphill walk from the train station. The hotel looked older and was furnished as such.
reviews.title: A decent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was pretty good and the staff was friendly. Not quite what we were expecting but we would probably stay there again with the hotel's convenient location to downtown Siena.
reviews.title: Great location for centre of Siena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we got was more than ample for the 2 of us, well decorated with good toilet facilities.
reviews.title: Very nice

likes.liked: — Bathroom, Breakfast, proximity to train station/city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedding was changed every day.
reviews.title: OK for short stay
Excellent two star hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Italia for four nights at Christmas and the staff were very helpful. Our room was clean, quiet, and fit all four of us with a double bed and two singles. A good breakfast and drinks available anytime. Terrific value.

A great hotel. The hotel is about a 15 minutes walk from the main train station. The staff were very nice, always welcomed us with a smile. They sell bus/ metro tickets, stamps, and have a high speed internet laptop available for guests. They have alot of tourist info as well. There is a book case with books, many in english, you can take to your room and read. The breakfast is good and filling. The rooms are small, and so is the bathroom, but very clean. There is a bus stop outside the hotel where you can catch the main buses to see the city. The walk to the spanish steps is about 10-15 minutes. The only bad thing I have to say about the hotel is that the towels are rather thin. Other than that I have nothing else bad to say about this hotel. Would stay here again. When you reach the hotel go thru the door under the hotel sign (if it is locked, buzz the hotel receptionist) and enter the last door on the right. There is an elevator or you can take the stairs to reception.
reviews.title: STAY HERE!
Good for a 2 star hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel in september of 2004 for 3 nights. We were in a double room with AC for roughly 113 euros a night. The room was large with lots of closets and space. The bed was comfy and the entire room was very clean. We also had hardwood floors which was kind of nice. However I am a large man at 6'4 and the shower was so small I could barely fit in it. I had to squeeze to get into it. The shared shower room seemed to be a bit larger but being a squeemish American I went with in suite. The location I found to be very convienant. The hotel is on a side street of one of the main streets in rome( nationale?) and we ran into no noise problems even with the windows open. You are within walking distance of the coloseum, roman forums, and a few other scenic sites. However take a taxi or ride the subway to the vatican. It's only a few minutes walk to the closest subway stop Republicca. I found this to be irritating but only after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The staff were very curteous and friendly and always had good advice on good places to eat and how to get around town. The breakfast buffet was good but not the greatest I've ever had. And I highly reccomend the little pizza shop across the street. We ate there several times and had wonderful meals!

reviews.title: Good experience at Hotel Italia
reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Italia last year for 6 nights and thought it was a good value for the money. It is clean. The staff is competent and friendly. They have great suggestions for restaurants, sights, and the best way to get around the city. My room was small but that's what I paid for; everything worked well and it had just had some modern updates. The location is outstanding. They serve a small and limited continental breakfast for those interested in that sort of thing. I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Very good value in Rome
reviews.text: This is a nice and very clean hotel. The rooms are clean and the baths, while small (with very small showers) were spotless. The staff is extremely courteous. The breakfast is a modest buffet style that was not the best I have had in Europe, although it was certainly not the worst and provided a decent start to the day. My only complaint is that the doors to the rooms are paper thin and noise transmits through them very easily so you cannot be a later riser (I am not). The walls were thick as brick and the small street has no scooter traffic (or any traffic), and thus is quite quiet. It is a reasonable walk to the Colosseum, the Victor Emanuel monument, etc. but is about a half hour walk to the Vatican (and I walk fairly fast). The Termini station is quite convenient on foot as well. I recommend this hotel overall and it is a very good value in a city where hotels can cost far more.

reviews.title: Great hotel, great value!
reviews.text: The Hotel Italia is a terrific option for budget travelers. People who gave this hotel a poor review were perhaps expecting the Four Seasons (??), but then again, I'm not sure why these same folks are on the Trip Advisor website if that is the type of hotel they are looking for. My sister and I recently stayed for three nights in November 2004. We were very pleased - the room was of decent size and very clean. The bathroom was also very clean and plenty big for an average sized person. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to the Colosseum and Forums as well as the main train station (Termini) and the city's subway system. We were there (unknowingly) during the MTV Europe music awards - which took place approximately 5 minutes from the hotel - and yet we didn't have any problems with noise. The complimentary breakfast was tasty and plentiful, and finally, the staff was terrific!! The only downfall is that indeed their towels are quite thin, but they do the job. I would definitely return to this hotel.

We have stayed in practically all european countries many times, + USA: Hotel Italia was by far the best Hotel, for cleanliness, Central location Accommodation, & facilities such as a small library and the use of internet - nice to have a hotel with a elevator: it was certainly the Best Breakfast of any Hotel we have stayed in: so efficient, an absolute joy to eat the fresh bread rolls, pastries, and the huge selection of teas and coffee's: Pastry and Bread baskets were kept full all the time, also a selection of cereal, juice and yogurt and even pizza: everywhere was spotless. Beautiful italian towels in Bathroom - wonderful for drying, plenty of hot water and Rooms left sparkling every day. Oh, and the price is unbeatable: 80 euros per double room, the breakfast alone is easily worth 10 euros each. Cannot be beaten on Location, Price, Accommodation, and Cleanliness.
reviews.title: Best of All
Disappointing
reviews.text: Thanks to all the helpful staff, All very welcoming and friendly, and will do anything to help, without being too pushy.

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: Disappointing. Our room (double for 113 Euros) was dreary and noisy, even in the annex which is supposed to be a little nicer. Towels are paper thin. Cancellation policy is atrocious (lose 1 night payment if cancel within 10 days and lose the full stay if cancel within 5 days) and they don't tell you about it until after they have your confirmation with credit card info. This policy was not listed on the website either. We stayed at 2 other hotels in Rome in a similar price range during this trip and Hotel Italia was definitely at the bottom of the heap in terms of noise, quality of room, and reservation flexibility. I would not recommend it.

reviews.title: Clean, good for price
reviews.text: I booked a single room 75 euro and found it to be a great value. Location was very good, right off via nazionale, close to metro station Republicca. I walked or used the metro to get to all tourist sites. It was noisy but so is Rome, bring a cd player and a headset or earplugs if you are a light sleeper. The staff was very courteous and spoke english. I would stay there again.

Stayed as part of Cosmos tour - fine for basic accomodation - dont expect much else. Like all the other cheapo hotels Cosmos uses - Italia also controls the AC and turns if off most of the time. Very basic breakfast.
reviews.title: Basic - cheapo hotel

likes.disliked: — Very basic - cheapo hotel for low budgets & tour groups

reviews.text: Not close, not far from main spots. There are closer but you'll pay more.
reviews.title: Ok but not great
Very Nice
reviews.text: As a budget tourist - sure you can stay there. Family - no. With Cosmos - you will stay there - tolerable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ok for a night or two. Rooms are very basic and not in a great state of repair. Everything was very clean and all basic needs are met. Location is good. There is a 5 min walk into the city walls but after that you are in an area that is lovely to explore.
reviews.title: not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you get a good rate go for it!
reviews.title: NO A/C!!!!!

likes.disliked: — Do Not Visit Italy in July or August - EXTREMELY HOT!!!!!!

reviews.text: My girlfried and I stayed here originally booked in for 7 days. We left a day early. The girls that worked the breakfast were fabulous and very accomodating, also too were the chamber maids. Very friendly and tired to make conversation even with the language difficulties. It was the 2 men that worked the front desk that we found very rude, impolite and not willing to help with any questions we had on were to eat, directions, or to explain a charge on our bill we did not understand. It seemed to us that because we were canadians that did not speak Italian they could not be bothered with us. There was a younger gentleman that worked one of the nights we were there and was most helpful, but not the two older men. We would have left earlier but we could not make othere arrangements. As soon as we could we left. We were all over Italy and stayed at a total of 5 hotels on this
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

likes.liked: — The service from chamber maids and waitresses
likes.disliked: — The two front hotel desk men

reviews.text: trip and several other hotels in life time and never encountered such rudeness and been treated with such disrespect.
reviews.title: Ruined our visit to Siena

reviews.text: Since we booked our holiday at the last minute (my wife and I), we chose hotel Italia on the basis of what was still available in Siena, location (walking distance to the centre), price and rather OK tripadvisor reviews. We booked a triple room because we travelled with our 10 year old daughter. First of all, the hotel does not look at all as on its website. The hotel was renovated but it looks like the pictures were taken just after the renovation. The hotel looks gloomy and tired. Our room, a "superior" triple room, which according to the receptionist are all on the front of the hotel on the busy Via Cavour (+ in front a busy intersection) are to be avoided, if possible. We asked to see another room and the receptionist proposed us another standard (not renovated) room in the back of the building on the ground floor at the same rate. This room was quieter (the bathroom was not renovated otherwise I did not see any difference with a superior room) but situated above the cellar with the boiler producing hot water. There were also single and double rooms next to our room which had the same problem because one could hear the boiler working in the hallway that led to our room. We choose this room - not because we liked it - but because the other room was far too noisy because of the traffic. The boiler under our room worked all night, which means that we did not get much sleep. The parking (free of charge) is very small but there is parking space on the street behind the hotel. The distance from the hotel to the gate of the old town is about 8 minutes and from there on you have to walk at least 20 minutes to get to the Piazza del Campo, which does not correspond to the advertisment of the hotel, which mentions 10 minutes to the "old town". Going back to the hotel after a busy day visiting Siena to rest is not a good bet because at night you have to go out again and walk to the city (30 minutes), except if you choose to have dinner in the only decent place around which is a fish restaurant, on the other side of the street just before the city gate. Finally, the hotel is situated just outisde the city walls in a very ugly and inpersonal neighborhood, where one does not really wants to stay when one aniticpates to visit a town for its unique atmosphere. In fact, the hotel ruined our visit to Siena and that's why we decided to shorten our visit and leave the hotel the next day.
reviews.title: Very Nice hotel

likes.liked: — Lovely hotel, walking distance to Center Historical

reviews.text: I have to agreed with another viewer. This boutique hotel is the best one in the Cosmos Budget Tour. Hotel is small but room was ample, clean, lovely with nice size bathroom. Breakfast was also the best one among the 4 hotels we stayed during the tour. Fresh , yes FRESH danish pastry, and lot of Salami, ham etc...and very good Fresh Bread...
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel

likes.liked: — charming, bigger than normal bathroom, comfortable bedroom

reviews.title: fine but service poor
reviews.text: Once we arrived, we walked out and followed the signs. It's about 15 minutes walk and stroll pleasantly, we got to The Palio !!! Itwas so great . If you ask us if we would stay here again, the answer is "absolutely".

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights on two separate occasions on our recent cycling holiday. The hotel has a good location if you don’t mind walking, but it is at least off the main touristy area. The hotel is approx a 10 – 15 minute walk to the Porta Camollia and then another 10 minute walk away from the main square, Piazza del Campo. It has a bar area, friendly staff and a nice lobby area with pictures adorning the walls. There is internet access, but at 8 Euros for an hour (nothing less) then it may pay to go to an internet café. There is limited parking for those with cars, and there are bike racks for those with bikes.
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel, Good Location

likes.liked: — Good location if you don't mind walking, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — The second bathroom we stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first two nights were spent in the annex, with the room being of reasonable size with en suite shower room, safe, mini bar and TV with BBC World – something you don’t often get. The last night was spent in the main hotel and the room was smaller, but comfortable enough. The only issue I have here was with the bathroom, which was more like a wet room. Not a problem in itself, but the drain didn’t work well and so the whole of the bathroom floor filled up with water and remained there for a while until it drained away leaving a soapy residue all over the floor. So if you do want to stay here it may be wise to ask for a room in the annex building where the shower was a cubicle.
reviews.title: A couple of issues but overall OK

likes.disliked: — Blocked plughole in bathroom, expensive internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was ok, with a choice of sweet breads, rolls, cheese and ham as well as a choice of cereals, tinned fruit and yoghurts.
reviews.title: Charming but a little smelly

likes.liked: — How close we could walk to Sienna's town area

reviews.text: There is a good pizza place a five minute walk away, on the same side of the road just next to an old stone archway.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.text: All in all a reasonable place to stay which is within easy reach of the centre and a 15 minute walk from the station (uphill on the way to the hotel), although I wouldn’t agree with other reviewers who say that it is a boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Run don't walk away

likes.disliked: — Everything else was just terrible. Worst travel experience in over 20 years.

description: Welcome to Hotel Italia!In the heart of the storical Rome next to the Quirinale, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Termini station and the Colosseum, an exclusive and elegant place is going to offer you a relaxing and confortable stay !
